headline: FTC bans junk fees on event tickets, hotel bookings
summary: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) banned junk fees on live event tickets, hotel bookings, and vacation rentals as agency chair Lina Khan pushes for better transparency from these industries' prices on and billing. Market Domination Overtime's Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton report more on this news. Airline executives met with Congress at the beginning of December to address the operators' own use of alleged junk fees. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.
